content: stitch for 1 5 cast off in pattern weave in ends wet block if desired jack o lantern styling get creative use the contrasting yarn to design a face to put on the sweater to be seen on your cat s back techniques to add the stitches for the face can include duplicate stitching with the caveat that if you do this like i did you may end up haunting yourself with the ghosts of knitting gods past - as you may have noticed that to achieve the ribbing shape of a pumpkin there are in fact purl stitches on the rs of your work and duplicate stitch is definitely only for knit stitches so if you are going the route of duplicate stitching just know that you will end up having to cheat and put duplicate stitches over purl stitches in the best way that you can to get them to blend in with the knit duplicate stitches also feel free to use the contrasting yarn as a sort of embroidery thread that you can use to embroider a face or feel free to not use the contrasting yarn at all and instead opt for felt or some other material you have on hand to put a face to your cat s sweater the skies the limit the final piece should measure 10 in length tips for measuring the best sweater size for your cat there are three important measurements to keep in mind 1 distance between front legs 2 circumference of the chest 3 distance from neck to the bottom edge of the sweater the main measurement to use for sizing is the circumference of your cat measurement number 2 as the other two measurements can be adjusted for easily with a longer shorter sweater or an extra less stitch between arm holes also remember the gauge 5 stitches per inch to help with adjusting custom sizing for your cats needs and it is hard to measure cats sometimes and sometimes their fur may be extra fluffy so use your best judgement in deciding on measurements do reach out if you have any questions or concerns i d love to see your finished knits - tag me @sarabethanyyy on instagram <3
